ðŸ”¥ muzi | Zig
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Providing a fast, keyboard-driven interface for controlling an MPD server from the terminal.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Queue manipulation â€¢ Fuzzy find through entire song library â€¢ Music browser for manual browsing â€¢ Vim-keybindings â€¢ Written in Zig
ðŸ“– Summary: Muzi is a terminal-based music player daemon (MPD) client written in Zig. It offers a slick, Vim-like interface with fuzzy finding for efficient music library navigation and queue management.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ BrowserOS | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide a privacy-conscious, locally-controlled browsing experience enhanced by AI agents that run directly within the browser, rather than relying on cloud services.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Open-source Chromium fork â€¢ Privacy-first design â€¢ Native AI agent execution â€¢ Support for local AI models (Ollama, LMStudio) â€¢ Familiar Chrome-like interface and extension compatibility
ðŸ“– Summary: BrowserOS is an open-source, privacy-focused browser built on a Chromium fork, designed to run AI agents natively within the browser. It offers a familiar Chrome-like interface and supports local AI models, making it a secure alternative to cloud-based AI browsing tools.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ Converseen | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Batch processing of images for conversion, resizing, and manipulation across multiple platforms.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Batch image conversion â€¢ Batch image resizing â€¢ Image rotation and flipping â€¢ PDF to image conversion â€¢ Support for 100+ image formats
ðŸ“– Summary: Converseen is a free, cross-platform batch image processor that allows users to convert, resize, rotate, and flip an unlimited number of images with a single click. It leverages ImageMagick to support over 100 image formats and can also convert PDF documents into image sets.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ ostt | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Real-time audio recording and transcription within a terminal environment, with advanced audio metering and AI-powered text conversion.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Real-time audio visualization (frequency spectrum or waveform) â€¢ Noise gating â€¢ dBFS-based volume metering â€¢ Audio clipping detection â€¢ Audio compression
ðŸ“– Summary: OSTT is an interactive, terminal-based tool for recording audio and transcribing it into text using various AI providers. It features real-time audio visualization, noise gating, and a browsable history of transcriptions, designed for performance and minimal dependencies on Linux and macOS.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ containerd | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide a robust and portable container runtime for managing container lifecycles, intended for integration into larger orchestration systems.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Manages complete container lifecycle â€¢ Image transfer and storage â€¢ Container execution and supervision â€¢ Low-level storage and network attachments â€¢ Designed for embedding into larger systems
ðŸ“– Summary: containerd is an industry-standard, open, and reliable container runtime that manages the complete container lifecycle. It handles image transfer, storage, execution, and supervision, designed for embedding into larger systems.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
